definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

pinyin: ji1 bu4 ke3 shi1 , shi1 bu4 zai4 lai2
ji1 bu4 ke3 shi1 , shi2 bu4 zai4 lai2

sentences.english: I felt now or never and went right up to him.
sentences.chinese: 我感覺到機不可失，所以徑直走到他面前。

sentences.english: Take time when time comes lest time steal away.
It's now or never, shall we chance it?
sentences.chinese: 機不可失，時不再來。咱們要不要碰碰運氣？

sentences.english: That is a good offer and we should take fortune at the tide.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個很好的機會，我們要機不可失。

definition: a thousand pounds hangs by a thread (idiom)/imminent peril/a matter of life or death
to turn a blind eye to
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
lit. severe floods and fierce beasts (idiom)/fig. great scourges/extremely dangerous or threatening things
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
